list_definition.definition: a group of houses, blocks of flats, street etc where the conditions are dirty and overcrowded and the building(s) usually in a bad state

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That new block of flats is rapidly turning into a slum

list_ex_of_english: The great number of children without citizenship in the slums results largely from the fact that children are born of common-law marriages, and women run off, leaving their children behind.
Let us imagine that there is a dwelling in one of these slums to be cleared away.
Gentleman made reference to certain houses which were provided under a previous scheme, which, he said, had deteriorated into slums.
The authority was determined to clear away its slums and it made great sacrifices to do it.
They should also not forget to provide hotter houses for those who are now housed in slums.
The first thing you have to do in clearing away slums is to have a place to put the unfortunate people.
We hear quite a lot about slums and overcrowding, and about rats, bugs, mice, and other creatures.
The frequent police interventions caused disputes previously confined to the mill compound to now spill over on to the streets, bazaars and slums of the mill towns.
